intro: Pfeiffera paranganiensis, commonly known as the Paranganiensis pfeiffera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with woody stems and palmate leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer seasons. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
